Molding Manager
Purpose of Position.            

We're looking for a proven leader who's eager to grow, manage, and inspire a group that includes but not limited to Molding Engineering (Process, Tooling, Maintenance, Drying, Mfg. data), Supply Chain, Production and Quality. As a hands-on Molding Manager, you'll get the opportunity to shape and implement standard processes for a molding operation as well as make key decisions. Where to make product
The Molding Manager manages direct and indirect labor, raw materials, supplies, machines and equipment resources maximizing results in productivity, quality in a timely basis with a minimum cost. Ensures coordination of the department efforts to achieve Key Performance Indicators (KPI's) like safety, OEE, labor efficiency, quality, schedule attainment, material usage variance and strongly supports the success of new product launches and productivity projects and overall Operations objectives. 
You'll be a key member of the leadership team and an integral part of helping our company achieve short-term delivery targets and longer-term growth and sustainability goals.

Responsibilities
Provide leadership, coaching to managers and supervisors to achieve all goals in Safety, OEE, Labor Efficiency, Quality, Schedule Attainment, and Material Usage Variance 
Define and drive standardized work (SOPs) throughout all areas and functions 
Implement, maintain, and always enforce 5S discipline throughout the operation areas 
Lead TPM culture across the functions and individuals 
Fully embrace and drive HOP safety management philosophy, striving to achieve a culture where individuals learns and feed/adjust systems for long term sustainability of safety 
Develop a leadership culture centered on agility, strategic thinking and people development & engagement 
Ensure that organizational capability is properly align with business landscape and organization objectives 
Lead the organization to master Pex/Lean/Quality core and advanced tools to evolve while embrace new manufacturing technologies and methods to deliver a true lean and agile Molding Operation 
Ensure workforce resources are adequate to meet the organization's production schedule and efficiency targets 
Evaluate production and determine ways to improve efficiency of operations while ensuring the achievement of quality standards and delivery under customer expectations 
Ensure that issues regarding new/existing products are resolved in a timely and cost-efficient manner 
Train, develop, mentor, and assist subordinates in all of the departments that fall within Molding operation 
Monitor and drive optimization of the inventory of raw materials, molded components, IMMs, ancillary equipment, tooling, molds and components, operating supplies, and capital expenditures. 
Monitor and assist with the establishment of tool samples and design experiments for new and existing molds and new molded components, including NPI.
Coordinate and manage the tooling demands and requirements for the manufacturing facility and support the molding operations. 
Coordinate and implement standard processes for tooling, molding, and process controls between company molding locations across division in alignment with corporate initiatives. 
Manage tooling and piece part cost for the company along with external vendor(s). 
Collaborate with staff to determine whether tooling and molded components should be manufactured in-house or procured from outside vendor(s). 
Lead project management of work taking place at outside vendors 
Partner with MDE, Technology, Product Lines, and other divisional groups in the coordination and success of any new launches in area of responsibility 
Other duties as assigned 

Knowledge and Skill Requirements.

Education.

Bachelor of Science or MS Degree in Engineering (Manufacturing/Operations)  
Preferred a degree with emphasis in Plastic Injection Molding or related 
        Work Experience

+10 years' of technical experience in manufacturing environment related to Molding, tooling and equipment maintenance, product development and product introduction. 
+5 years' managerial experience with 3 years or more experience managing molding department(s) and/or tool room(s) 

Competencies

Acting Decisively 
Financial Analysis & Management (Manufacturing) 
Manufacturing Strategy Formation and Execution  
Self-motivated and driven 
Inspiring and Motivating Others 
Act with Integrity and Authenticity 
Be Confident and Adaptable 
Champion Change and Flexibility 
Establish Direction and Create Commitment 
Foster Innovation and Risk Taking 
Leverage Talent 
Focus on Customers 
Drive Deployment 
Prioritizing and Organizing Work 
Working with Ambiguity  
Problem solving 
Experience with tooling and IMM maintenance 
Experience with P&L and managing budgets
